import React, { Fragment, Component } from 'react' import PropTypes from 'prop-types' import './CrosswordPage.css' import pause from '../../images/pause.png' class CrosswordPage extends Component { constructor (props) { super(props) this.state = { windowWidth: window.innerHeight, id: this.props.crossword.id, title: this.props.crossword.title, date: this.props.crossword.date, difficulty: this.props.crossword.difficulty, numbered: this.props.crossword.numbered, grid: this.props.crossword.grid, acrossClues: this.props.crossword.acrossClues, downClues: this.props.crossword.downClues, clueRefMap: this.props.crossword.clueRefMap } this.handleWindowResize = this.handleWindowResize.bind(this) } componentDidMount () { window.addEventListener('resize', this.handleWindowResize) } componentWillUnmount () { window.removeEventListener('resize', this.handleWindowResize) // save state of grid } handleWindowResize () { this.setState({ windowWidth: window.innerHeight }) } render () { const { id, title, date, difficulty, numbered, grid, acrossClues, downClues, clueRefMap } = this.state let screenWidth = window.innerWidth console.log(screenWidth) let clueWidth = "" + (screenWidth - 790 - 2) + "px" return (
{ this.props.backSelected() }}> {'<'} Save progress and go back

{row.map( square =>
{square.value === '?' || square.value === '_' ? '' : square.value}

) } } CrosswordPage.propTypes = { crossword: PropTypes.object.isRequired, backSelected: PropTypes.func.isRequired } export default CrosswordPage
